Posts.Content: A big thank you Aspen for your reply.  I've only just seen the replies today having got my laptop to work finally and am grateful for that suggestion of yours (love the cryptic clue btw) and will look for that in the pharmacy to tide me over until I can get a consultation with GP and a prescription for something that's compatible with the Exemestane.    Have a nice weekend if possible.  Hope the weather is good wherever you are.
Posts.Title: Pesky mouth ulcers driving me crazy

Posts.Content: Hello maggiemee  what a great idea, thank you so much.    I'm glad this works for you      This is something I can shop for when I'm next in the big supermarket and if I can  get them with a long shelf life will be a back up to what others have recommended too. Hugs.
Posts.Title: Pesky mouth ulcers driving me crazy

Posts.Content: Ruby Rose thanks for your friendly and encouraging reply, glad you got something for yours btw.   I cannot count the number of times when 'something' c related suddenly happens it's on a Friday just as pharmacy etc close and hospital team leaves the answerphone on!   Thank heavens for Macmillan being here 24/7 and especially weekends to help us along until Monday mornings  <3       I'll do as you suggest and try and get some prescription drugs which will be compatible with the Exemestane and hopefully the BCN can do this for me soonest as  I have to be on it for 5 years.    Thanks again and hope you have a good w/e as best you can  ~   hugs
Posts.Title: Pesky mouth ulcers driving me crazy

Posts.Content: Thanks chrispc for your reply and recommendation.  Yep agree, I do the same while trying not to if that makes sense.  I hope yours ease or go away eventually  -  we don't want these annoying things on top of everything else it throws at us do we?!  Best wishes for a good weekend.
Posts.Title: Pesky mouth ulcers driving me crazy

Posts.Content: Thanks Ruby Rose  and by coincidenec today after waiting 7 months for counselling my name has finally appeared near the top of the list  and have an appointment locally next week as someone had cancelled so I wonder how that will go.     Thanks for the info on Breast Cancer Care helpline, not heard of them (sooo much happened and misty fog moments with the SE's) so that is another place to try.   The Macmillan centre and Maggies Centre are in my region but its too far away to get too and from on public transport and I have mobility problems as well as on Aspergers women over 55 spectrum which added to all the c stuff well kind of makes it more challenging putting it mildly but it was a kindly meant suggestion  I sometimes help my hubby (who is still getting his head around the diagnosis) with his mega jigsaws and now the days are getting longer its easier on the eyes.    He gets his from a hospice charity shop and I get books from them too. Meanwhile hope that mammo goes ok and the results are what you want to heart. Just phoned my son who lives and works in Scotland, he is ok so that gives me peace of mind, time for a cuppa now.
Posts.Title: Pesky mouth ulcers driving me crazy

Posts.Content: Another s/e added to the growing list while taking Exemestane as its hormone related.  Had them 2 weeks now and nothing seems to work, short of coming off this medication which I know won't be approved by the hospital team! I read somewhere that it might also be due to lack of zinc or iron in post menopause women but got confused with the volume of info so  would be grateful if anyone can give me tips how to ease them please if you have experienced similar.  Am on soft food and nothing spicy or too hot any more.  Thank you.
Posts.Title: Pesky mouth ulcers driving me crazy

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, glad to read this post and all the replies, t y s m for the suggestions of makes and shops or online to try which you found worked for you.   My lumpectomy, r/t etc. etc. was a year ago but Bettyboob the one operated on is playing me up and hates ALL the bras I bought from different sources while the other one (Brenda) yep crazy names but sense of humour has and continues to help me through the cr*p   ........ I am, how they say, mega curvy.    Betty still itches and appears like jaffa orange peel from time to time plus the scar hurts but the bras had to come off after half an hour they dug in so much, so will look online especially the crop style ones as 'Brenda' needs her uplift too!!     Hope you all continue to do OK on your respective long healing bc journeys.  Gentle hugs.
Posts.Title: Bras!!!

Posts.Content: Hello youngatheart so much of what you and the others who wrote on this thread has resonated.   I feel still in limbo first anniversary coming up, so many emotions whirling around in my head, time flies by and am nervous about the mammogram as BettyBoob is not behaving herself.   But moving on quickly before I forget to say it I was sorry to read of the loss of your friend.    Also what hit home is a similar situation for me, hubby's "well you seem lots better now and not so bad tempered"  I mean with all the crap we put up with on the journey to think I would be all smiles and sweetness and light while trying to be strong for everyone!    I showed him my scars and one look said it all and have hidden them ever since and totally agree we, well most of us, will never be 'normal' again as in what we were but fighters we are and I wish you and everyone else in the BC group the bestest of luck and love for your continuing bc journey.
Posts.Title: A year

Posts.Content: Hello Lecca, I had the same said to me by many in different tones of voice so can emphasise.  I'm on the autistic spectrum middle age 50+ Aspergers so reading between the lines isnt easy at the best of times but I try to imagine what they say is kindly meant while at the same time wondering (not referring to supportive in so many ways people here on the Macmillan) its the outsiders so called friends (we quickly know who is there to support and who melt away) well this might not have happened to you but its kind of maybe they are unsure of what to say so repeat what they read or hear from others like a generic phrase and I have yet to let the tears flow and I was diagnosed last year but back to you I hope it goes well in fact I found the r/t the easiest to cope with and hope you will too and you make a full recover eventually.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: Hello Grogg your words really struck a chord with me especially the last two lines and hope you are ok if I 'borrow' them if and when the need arises as you put it just right and thank you for that.   One thing is little 'ole me who was really shy has come right out of her shell during this unwanted journey and toughened up and stand up to those who are unkind with their choice of words, one family member  seemed a bit jealous she was not getting attention as I seemed to be hogging the limelight which is crazy and yet have learnt so much and crossed paths also with a few people who have been amazingly supportive.  My sibling family lived 800 round miles away and not seen them for years so being on here and letting off steam now and then is good.    After this lot and its still ongoing and will be for years while we get our check ups and repeat mammos done etc. I'd like to do counselling never too old to try something new and if it comforts those really in need then well enough said it would begiving something back.   Wishing you all the bestest of wishes.
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: Oh Violetsniff  what a great post and reading the comment about the catatonc trance had me in fits of giggles!    Tbh I'm the same well  think so as in extra curvy + as I think of it yet legs like runner bean poles, plus wobby bits in the middle that started appearing not long after starting the Exemestane.  Was told cut out or down on sugar but will power sigh!     I like the Whar duar meddle wi me slogan (I live in Geordieland and so similar words with subtle differences abound here being not far from the Border)
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: Wishing you a full recovery in time AnnJac and best wishes from me  :)          As for the auxiliary nurse, heck, some staff (not all I hasten to add) need to get their brain into gear before they open their mouths!!      Like the banter and giggle moments on this particular thread as it lifts our spirits and every smiley moment is a positive, plus to know we are not alone in our bc recovery journeys is very comforting.  I've picked up a few useful phrases from some of the lovely ladies on here to speak back when the occasion next arises which it surely will ! Am away now to make a builder's brew cuppa as we say in this region.
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: Thanks peterawake and other special ladies for replying to my comment   -  I get brain mist moments from the SEs and not sure how to get your names up all together into this box but the warmth of your replies to me and the original poster made a little tear come to my eye and am sending a gentle virtual hug across the counties and miles to wherever you live.   Not all people of course but many think its like we have just recovered from a very very bad bout of 'flu and then its all smiles and on we go except we know that it isnt and its been a massive learning curve in more ways than one.    One step at a time and best wishes back at you Sharon.
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: Hello youngatheart I echo your comments especially about afterwards just collecting a script and then we are out on our own unless its something really serious which is what it was in the first place not just a sniffully cold. I felt and have not shared this with anyone , wracked with guilt at times that mine was 'only' small and I survived thanks to the surgical and RT team with that amazing spaceage technology machine which I gave a nickname to in order to get comfortable through that part.  Plus bleepy determination that this newly retired was not going to let it beat me so did some complementary therapies to keep stress and anxiety levels under control and I shed more tears for the ladies who were diagnosed with stages 3 and 4.  Like you say its hell like a rollercoaster ride and we have to strap in extra  tight!!    I hope you get to see your bc team this month and its going to go ok lots of luck from me.
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: Leolady56 What a wonderful supportive down to earth reply post and thank you for sharing it with us ladies you are amazing and good luck to you aswell for now and the future lots of love and good vibes heading your way.
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: A big thank you Misty Blue for your lovely reply.   I totally agree that writing takes our mind off the bleepy c and all it's SEs to escape to  a more gentler world and then suddenly whoosh we are back down to earth with a bump and reality.  I have a 'short' story of 5,000 words most likely suited for the over 40s and a few magazines in mind if I meet their T & Cs to post the manuscript to, something light hearted and gentle plus a subtle and unexpected love twist.    Good for you with the re-working and I wish you lots of luck with the new publisher of your book and that is brilliant how you have done all that while coping with the unwanted c, so hugs from me!
Posts.Title: Abandoned, Isolated, Alone

Posts.Content: Hi Misty BlueBlue -  I had a nudge to respond to your post and tbh had a misty moment while doing so as it triggered off unwanted flash backs for me too which I need professional help to resolve -   but back to you -   you are not alone and I truly hope you find all the help you need as there are some amazingly caring people here  who offer love, empathy and support in a variety of ways that helps cope with a bleepy c journey.   That is great about writing a book, I dabble in short stories and can understand the part you wrote about living in the past as it all becomes so real and I fully believe (while some may disagree!) that we can time travel to that era with a strong imagination and energy link to that moment which sometimes makes the words flow mega quickly so hope you can complete it and thinking of you Good Luck  -  my best wishes.
Posts.Title: Abandoned, Isolated, Alone
